flawed_nl_solution:
If Flying Scotsman had 20 more carriages than Norwich, and Norwich had 100 carriages, then Flying Scotsman had 100 + 20 = <<20+100=120>>120 carriages.
Together, Flying Scotsman and Norwich had 120 +100 = <<120+100=220>>220 carriages.
If Euston had 130 carriages, 20 more carriages than Norfolk, Norfolk had 130 - 20 = <<130-20=101>>101 carriages.
Together, Euston and Norfolk had 101 + 130 = <<101+130=231>>231 carriages.
Altogether, Euston, Norfolk, Norwich, and Flying Scotsman had 231 + 220 = <<231+220=451>>451 carriages.
#### 451

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 110, not 101. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
